explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of support vector regression (SVR) to model the relationship between stock prices and web financial information, which is a machine learning technique.
explanations.supervised learning: Support vector regression (SVR) is a supervised learning method, as it involves training a model on labeled data to predict continuous outcomes (stock price volatilities).
explanations.regression: The paper explicitly mentions using support vector regression (SVR) to model the relationship between stock prices (P) and web information time series (W), which is a regression task.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper uses support vector regression (SVR), which is a variant of support vector machines (SVM) adapted for regression problems.
explanations.SVM: Support vector regression (SVR) is based on the principles of support vector machines (SVM), making SVM a relevant keyword.
